summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no mention of Thomas N. Downing. The documents primarily consist of payroll records and related notifications from the Assassination Records Review Board concerning the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff. These records detail employee salaries, employment dates, and the postponement of Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy. The documents focus on administrative aspects of the HSCA's operations and do not provide any information about Thomas N. Downing or his involvement.
significance: Based on the provided documents, the significance of Thomas N. Downing in the JFK context cannot be determined as he is not mentioned in any of the documents.
